article_title: Tips for Using Community College to Cut the Cost of a Bachelor's Degree
article_text:
It's no secret that one way to reduce the cost of getting a bachelor's degree is to take classes at a less-expensive community college first.

What isn't nearly as well-known is how to go about saving that money.

For instance, some parents and students may not realize that not all community-college credits can be transferred and applied...

twitter.description: Starting at a community college can make getting a bachelor's degree less costly, as long as the credits transfer. Here's what you need to know.
twitter.title: A Low-Cost Strategy for a College Degree

image.alt: An engineering degree for less than $20k? Maybe, if you go to community college first.

What isn't nearly as well-known is how to go about saving that money.
